claims.claim: Incarcerated individuals are deprived of access to modern technology, impeding their reintegration into society.
claims.quote: You don't know how to use a phone, you don't know how to use a computer. [...] You don't need no computer. You don't need no cell phone.

claims.claim: Using outdated technology like typewriters in prison disconnects inmates from modern society.
claims.quote: Typewriters are outdated. They still using typewriters in prison and this is 2023.

claims.claim: Formerly incarcerated individuals feel alienated upon reentry due to technological advancement during their incarceration.
claims.quote: So the man and the woman that comes out of that environment is what? Alien to this world.

claims.claim: Technological advancements like Bluetooth can be bewildering to those incarcerated before such technology existed.
claims.quote: My mama said no, he on his Bluetooth. I said, what kind of two, his teeth is blue.

claims.claim: Learning to use modern gadgets is challenging but essential for reintegration.
claims.quote: Then when I did get a phone, I had to do the most intelligent thing in the world. And my mom, she laughed about it. She said, what are you doing? I said, I'm reading the manual.

claims.claim: The absence of technology education in prisons creates significant barriers to reentry.
claims.quote: So I read the manual, that's how I learned how to write use the phone, so those are some of the challenges that we face coming home not being, see, when you don't have access to modern technology, then you like a fish out of the water.
